intro: Aethiocarpa lepidota, commonly known as the velvetleaf or velvetleaf gourd, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its heart-shaped, hairy leaves and yellow-orange flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant produces fruits that are typically oblong or rounded, with a rough, warty surface. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Aethiocarpa lepidota is often found in moist, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and riverbanks.
